intro: Paronychia jamesii subsp. subglabra, commonly known as the smoothleaf sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its narrow, linear leaves that are covered with a fine, smooth layer of hair. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of local flora in its native habitat.
